content: Hi Joseph, if you are copy/pasting rather than attaching from disk, you may notice that the megabytes used by the image swell considerably. There is a setting to change the compression type for pasted images from PNG to JPEG, but this has no effect on the image dimensions. If it would help, see: https://support.mozilla.org/questions/1418102.
creator: jscher2000

creator: davidsk

content: Personally, I do not recommend using Gmail's AllMail folder, as it is a duplicate to other folders; is managed by Gmail, not thunderbird; increases disk space and slows processing; and often causes confusion to user. But that's just my opinion. But, I am not aware of any size restriction. I would exit TB, copy the mbox to the Mail\Local Folders folder and then restart TB.
creator: davidsk

content:
Paweł Siedlecki said
Hello, I am not receiving messages from a particular sender. How can I unblock this ? This is an important customer for me and I need to receive emails from him. Greetings, Pawel Siedlecki

Have you checked your Spam/Bulk/Junk folder? If it's a POP account, you'll have to check webmail, and if senders' mail is mistakenly sent to Spam, unblock or whitelist them through webmail controls.

content: That sounds like the folder is threaded. Highlight the folder, if menu bar is present, click view, sort by and tick 'unthreaded' . If menu bar is not visible, first press alt key and then click view and then sort by

content: Access Thunderbird's password vault and delete the stored passwords. See Password Manager - Remember, delete and change passwords in Thunderbird
creator: stancestans

content: Restoring from a backup is the best option. Why it happens every few months is beyond me. Anything could cause corruption of data. We could be looking at third-party software, especially antivirus programs. They are well known for causing havoc with Thunderbird. If you haven't already, I strongly recommend you add Thunderbird's data to your antivirus' exclusions list (whitelist).
creator: stancestans

content: This is a known shortcoming and the bug has been in review for a proper solution for several years. I do not anticipate this will be resolved soon.

content:
krzychumarkowski said
Win10 Pro system, version22H2. The master password is set, according to the instructions. When you start the Mozilla Thunderbird program, it shows a window requesting you to enter your password. After entering the password, the program launches correctly to the end. However, all you have to do is click the CANCEL button to access your mail bypassing the password. Why?

The primary, formerly master, password is not intended to protect the mail. It only guards access to the passwords. Other methods are required to secure the profile:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Protecting_the_contents_of_the_profile_-_mail
creator: sfhowes

content: - uninstall thunderbird - remove profile. If in Windows, that would be to delete the c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird folder.
creator: davidsk

content: Do not enter password when setting up a Gmail account. Instead, after entering other information, Google will prompt for id and password and then allow the account in Thunderbird.
creator: davidsk

content: Your id generally appears in upper right of screen. Clicking that allows you to view prior posts and then respond with them. And you don't post the error message, so it would be difficult to explain it.
creator: davidsk

content: Do not use mozbackup. Even the author recommends on website to not use. The safest backup is this; - exit thunderbird - copy c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming\thunderbird to external drive to restore: - exit thunderbird, if running - copy the backed up thunderbird folder to c:\users\<yourid>\appdata\roaming to overwrite the existing thunderbird folder. This works 100%. My suggestion here refers to Windows, but would be similar to other OSs.
creator: davidsk

content: If the profile is smaller than 2 GB, use Tools/Export... Tools/Import... to import.

content: Well, little is known about your specific setup. If you are using an anti-virus other than the windows Defender, that may be a serious cause. And you may have a slow email server from your email provider.

content: Well, the portable version doesn't support the established process. My suggestion is to download a prior version of portable thunderbird and install to a separate folder. Then, copy the profile from the 115 version to the prior version's profile. If there is a compatibility.ini file, I think you should delete it. And I think the older version should now run. I located this URL of prior versions. I have not used it, so use your own judgement: https://thunderbird-portable.en.uptodown.com/windows/versions
creator: davidsk

content: You'd be better off solving your issues with the current release instead of downgrading. To check individual accounts for new messages, right-click the cloud icon in the Folder Pane Header (enabled under View/Folders), or select from File/Get New Messages For.... Press Alt if the Menu Bar with File is hidden.
